p: The baseline composite inflammatory score was only predictive of MoCA score (beta = –0.205, p = 0.037) at 36 months ( Table 4), independently of age, gender, BMI and LEDD, but not for the rate of change for any clinical indicator over the follow-up period. None of our candidate baseline biomarkers of senescence and inflammation significantly predicted MMSE score ( Table 4) or motor function ( Table 5) either at 36 months or as rate of change over 36 months.
